trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects.
A <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> has a StylusPointCollection that contains <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects collected from a stylus and digitizer.
You can use the StylusPointCollection to customize the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects.
A generic IEnumerable of type <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
stylusPoints is .
The length of points is 0.
-or- The objects in stylusPoints have incompatible objects.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> class with specified points.

A generic IEnumerable of type <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that specifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
points is .
The length of points is 0.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> class that may initially contain the specified number of <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects.
When you use the StylusPointCollection constructor to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>, you specify it's `initialCapacity`.
However, you can add more <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Add%2A> method.
The number of <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> can initially contain.
initialCapacity is negative.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> class that contains the properties specified in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref>.

All <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects added to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> must have a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> that is compatible with `stylusPointDescription`.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> that specifies the additional properties stored in each <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
stylusPointDescription is .

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> class that is the specified size and contains the properties specified in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref>.

When you use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>, the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> is created with the capacity to hold the specified number of <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects.
You can add more <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects than `initialCapacity` by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Add%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> that specifies the additional properties stored in each <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The number of <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> can initially contain.
initialCapacity is negative.
stylusPointDescription is .
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> to add to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
stylusPoints is .
The of stylusPoints is not compatible with the property.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> changes.
To be added.
Removes all <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects from the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> is connected to a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref>.
Copies the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.

A new <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> that contains copies of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects in the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> into the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> at the specified position.
The position at which to insert the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
The of stylusPoint is not compatible with the property.
index is greater or equal to the number of objects in the .
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Changed"></xref> event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
To be added.
To be added.
Finds the intersection of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> and the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description*> property.

`subsetToReformatTo` is a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> which describes a subset of values belonging to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> property.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription.GetCommonDescription%2A> method to get a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> that intersects the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> of the current <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.

The Reformat method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> that contains the same <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects as those belonging to the current <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> objects in the new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection> uses `subsetToReformatTo` as the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription>.

> [!NOTE] > Reformat uses the constraints from the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointPropertyInfo> of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> property, even if the constraints in `subsetToReformatTo` are different.

For example, if `subsetToReformatTo` uses the values 0 and 1023 for <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.NormalPressure> whereas <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection.Description%2A> uses the values 0 and 255.
Reformat returns a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription> using the values, 0 and 255.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> to intersect with the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> that has a <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> that is a subset of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> and the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointDescription"></xref> that the current <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> uses.
subsetToReformatTo is not a subset of the property.
Removes the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> at the specified position from the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
The position at which to remove the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref> is connected to a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> and there is only one <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection"></xref>.
Sets the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> at the specified position.
The position at which to set the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> to set at the specified position.
The of stylusPoint is not compatible with the property.
index is greater than the number of objects in the .
Converts the property values of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects into a 32-bit signed integer array.
Converts the property values of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint"></xref> objects into a 32-bit signed integer array.
